body_html:
I encountered the same issue. And if I change this line embd_in = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [10,3]) to embd_in = tf.placeholder(tf.int32, [10,3]) and run the above code, I got InvalidArgumentError as expected.
Cannot figure out why is this related to dtype?
Also, the tf.gather() behaves the same as tf.embedding_lookup()

body:
I encountered the same issue. And if I change this line `embd_in = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [10,3])`  to `embd_in = tf.placeholder(tf.int32, [10,3])` and run the above code, I got InvalidArgumentError as expected. 
Cannot figure out why is this related to dtype?
Also, the `tf.gather()` behaves the same as `tf.embedding_lookup()`
